conclusion: Compute the Ampere forces on segments AB and BC separately and find their resultant.
Magnetic field for segment AB is into the page; current flows from A to B.
Using the Right-Hand Rule, the Ampere force on AB is directed upward.
Calculate magnitude of Ampere force on AB: F_AB = BIL.
Magnetic field for segment BC is out of the page; current flows from B to C.
Using the Right-Hand Rule, the Ampere force on BC is directed downward.
Calculate magnitude of Ampere force on BC: F_BC = BIL.
Both forces have equal magnitudes BIL but are in opposite directions.
Add the forces vectorially: F_net = F_AB - F_BC = 0.
The net magnitude of the Ampere force received by the wire is 0.
